com.koucha.experimentalgame.input

Class InputBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.koucha.experimentalgame.input.InputBridge

  • public class InputBridge
extends java.lang.Object
    Takes Input through doMouseMovement(int, int) and doKeyEvent(InputEvent) and forwards it according to the InputMap

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private InputMap inputMap
      This InputMap maps callbacks to key codes and is needed for dynamic forwarding of InputEvents
      private int mouseX 
      private int mouseY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputBridge() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doKeyEvent(InputEvent evt)
      Forwards the InputEvent to the destination linked in inputMap If nothing is linked, this method will return without doing anything
      void doMouseMovement(int posX, int posY)
      Saves the mouse position (can be retrieved via getMouseX() and getMouseY())
      InputMap getInputMap()
      Gives full access to inputMap This map of Key codes and callbacks is used for forwarding InputEvents
      int getMouseX() 
      int getMouseY() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • inputMap

        private InputMap inputMap
        This InputMap maps callbacks to key codes and is needed for dynamic forwarding of InputEvents

      • mouseX

        private int mouseX

      • mouseY

        private int mouseY

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputBridge

        public InputBridge()

    • Method Detail

      • doKeyEvent

        public void doKeyEvent(InputEvent evt)
        Forwards the InputEvent to the destination linked in inputMap

        If nothing is linked, this method will return without doing anything

        Parameters:
        evt - the Event that should be forwarded

      • doMouseMovement

        public void doMouseMovement(int posX,
                            int posY)
        Saves the mouse position (can be retrieved via getMouseX() and getMouseY())
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of the mouse position
        posY - y coordinate of the mouse position

      • getInputMap

        public InputMap getInputMap()
        Gives full access to inputMap

        This map of Key codes and callbacks is used for forwarding InputEvents

        Returns:
        inputMap

      • getMouseX

        public int getMouseX()
        Returns:
        x coordinate of the mouse position

      • getMouseY

        public int getMouseY()
        Returns:
        y coordinate of the mouse position
